channel.title: Wheel
channel.description:
So here's a teaser of what I'm currently working on. I just finished this part of it. Can anyone guess what car it is just by the rim?
I modeled it all in 3DS Max, but I made the tire itself in ZBrush.
I think some edges on the tire look funky. It's half cause I decimated the model (from 3 million polygons to ~200k) and half cause of the render settings.
Very fun and difficult to model though.
[img]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/12/bmwwheel.jpg[/img]

item.title: Wheel
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Sanga: I could, but to do that I would have to make polygons fit the shape of the text, while holding the side wall of the wheel’s curve. It’d be like a really difficult and time consuming puzzle. So what I ended up doing was making the shape, taking it into zbrush, dividing into the millions of polygons, then using masks and reference images I made the tread and the side text. At a few million polygons it looks great. But that’s not feasible in 3DS Max/Vray. And the new version of ZBrush doesn’t have the same displacement exporting and stuff and I don’t have time to figure that out. So I just decimated the model resulting in the same shape but fewer polygons. I did that to ~30%, with maybe a couple hundred thousand polygons. At 40% it still looked pretty much the same as the real deal, but it was around 500k polygons, multiply that by four wheels total and it’s still too much. So since I won’t be doing any super closeup work with the wheels, this is enough for me.

Fat Cookies: You mean less blurry so you can see the reflections clearer, or what? Cause they’re at full reflection, but pretty blurry. I’ll be adding some anistrophy and giving it more to reflect, so I don’t know if your suggestion is something to take srsly or if it’s a POV kinda thing and will look better with more stuff around.

Read full topic

item.title: Wheel
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Make the brake discs more metallic, they are too matt at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: Wheel
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:13, topic:317301”]fezz: Yeah. Started with the outside of the rim and worked my way in. Then with the tire I started from the outside of the rim and worked my way out, took it to zbrush.

sanga: That’s my only complaint. I was using masking/deformation tools and I’m guessing the scale was off in zbrush because a value of 1 gave me that, and you can’t go lower than 1. Smoothing it or trying to brush it all back in didn’t work, so I just kinda left it =/[/quote]
isnt there a way you could save the selction of polygons on the top of the text, then undo what you have done so its flat tire wall again then extrude the selection it an accurate height and just smooth the edges over?

Read full topic

item.title: Wheel
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

fezz: Yeah. Started with the outside of the rim and worked my way in. Then with the tire I started from the outside of the rim and worked my way out, took it to zbrush.

sanga: That’s my only complaint. I was using masking/deformation tools and I’m guessing the scale was off in zbrush because a value of 1 gave me that, and you can’t go lower than 1. Smoothing it or trying to brush it all back in didn’t work, so I just kinda left it =/

Read full topic

item.title: Wheel
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It’s grainy, because the samples are low, so I don’t have to wait for a long ass render. The object in question is not the grain though, is it.

It’s kinda “stretched” from the decimation, the original million+ poly model doesn’t stretch, but Max doesn’t handle polys as well as something like ZBrush. The real thing is that there’s triangles in that area and I didn’t play around with smoothing groups, which I don’t plan on considering this will be of lesser detail than the car, and playing with 100k+ polygons with smoothing groups is a fucking pain.

Back on topic.

Read full topic
